data.overview: High performance RESTful API layer designed in support of API-first development and the principle of COPE
data.description:
You can consider **DADI API** as the data layer within a platform (including the data model). It is designed to be plugged into a templating layer, a mobile application or to be used with any other data consumer.

Calls to a **DADI API** can contain your business/domain logic (the part of a platform that encodes the real-world business rules that determine how data is created, displayed, stored and changed). It has full support for searching, filtering, limiting, sorting, offsetting, input validation and data aggregation (Map-reduce).

**DADI API** provides a starting point that's further advanced than a framework. It allows you to get a complete data layer up and running in seconds.
.
features: Native document versioning at collection level
Cache data responses using a shared Redis layer or the filesystem

data.overview: High performance schema-less templating layer for browser-based product development
data.description:
**DADI Web** makes it easy to build custom enterprise-grade web applications. Easily create static pages or connect to APIs to generate data-driven apps giving you the power to search, paginate, sort and filter your data, on the server or in browser.

**DADI Web** uses [LinkedIn's Dust](http://www.dustjs.com/) templating language which provides a simple yet powerful template layer for displaying your data.
features: Connect to APIs to generate data-driven pages
Search, paginate, sort and filter your data
Cache data and HTML responses using Redis or the filesystem

data.overview: Just-in-time asset manipulation and delivery layer designed as a modern, global content distribution solution
data.description:
You can consider a full installation of DADI CDN as being analogous to a traditional CDN (Content Distribution Network) such as Akamai and Limelight. It is designed to carry the processing and delivery load associated with image manipulation and asset delivery (CSS/JS/fonts) and acts autonomously as a layer on top of your core product.

CDN has full support for caching, header control, image manipulation, image compression and image format conversion. An authenticated API allows for fine grained cache control in the form of content invalidation on an individual file or collective path basis.
features: Provides native document versioning at collection level
Can be run in a clustered configuration
Search, filter and sort your data with ease
Cache data responses using a shared Redis layer or the filesystem

data.overview: End to end CRM solution that guarantees the uniqueness of individuals – and powers segmentation – in the anonymous and known space
Real time individual-level data pipeline and aggregation service, built around the concept of events and actions
data.description:
**DADI Track** makes use of Node's non-blocking architecture to present a 1:1 view of tracked activity within a platform.

Track is deliberately lightweight: it maintains a temporary data pipeline and provides a framework for data consumers to iterate against the pipeline. Data consumers within Track can be used for aggregation, powering real time visualization (through [DADI Visualize](/platform/visualize/)), piping your data into existing platforms or triggering events within your product interfaces.

Events can be sent to Track from a client device, from within the wider DADI stack or via an API call.
features: Fully configurable consumer framework for data manipulation
Enables direct action on the back of events

data.overview: Scalable and straightforward predictive analysis API with machine learning at its heart
data.description:
**Match** is an API that simplifies customer-based predictions by leverage specific machine learning techniques.

Very basically, events go into **DADI Match** - our machine learning product - and predictions about future events come out.

It uses the concepts of events - familiar to anyone that has used _Google Analytics_ - to allow for the simple collection of data points to model against.
features: Real time predictive analysis through machine learning
API-based application, enabling simple integration with existing platforms
Can be leveraged to give predictions about any given outcome
